q_en: I am from The Hong Kong Polytechnic University. Today is July 2, 2024. Please help me create an order for 50 red T-shirts in size M and 30 blue sweaters in size XL.

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'PolyU';
steps.description: Retrieve the customer ID for the customer with the name "PolyU"

steps.sql: SELECT p.id FROM products p JOIN products_types pt ON p.products_type_id = pt.id WHERE p.attributes = 'M size' AND pt.description = 'Red' AND pt.description = 'T-shirt';
steps.description: Retrieve the product ID for the product with attributes "Red, M size" and type "T-shirt"

steps.sql: SELECT p.id FROM products p JOIN products_types pt ON p.products_type_id = pt.id WHERE p.attributes = 'XL size' AND pt.description = 'Blue' AND pt.description = 'Sweater';
steps.description: Retrieve the product ID for the product with attributes "Blue, XL size" and type "Sweater"

steps.sql: INSERT INTO orders (user_id, order_name, created_at) VALUES ('1', 'Order20240702194448', '2024-07-02 19:44:48');
steps.description: Create a new order with the default name and the retrieved customer ID

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE order_name = 'Order20240702194448';
steps.description: Retrieve the order ID for the newly created order

steps.sql: INSERT INTO order_product (order_id, product_id, number) VALUES ('13', '', 50);
steps.description: Insert 50 units of the product "Red T-shirt" into the order
steps.results: (1366, "Incorrect integer value: '' for column 'product_id' at row 1")

steps.sql: INSERT INTO order_product (order_id, product_id, number) VALUES ('13', '<blue_sweater_product_id>', 50);
steps.description: Insert 30 units of the product "Blue Sweater" into the order
steps.results: (1366, "Incorrect integer value: '<blue_sweater_product_id>' for column 'product_id' at row 1")
